result.execSummary:
The defendant Hugo C Galan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 5 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to court costs and DNA surcharge, balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the co-actor listed in the criminal complaint.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 3 MONTHS - Straight Time, commencing forthwith.
SECOND 3 MONTHS - to be served with huber (all standard release conditions).
LAST 3 MONTHS STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.  Court will allow for the condition time to be served in Milwaukee County if they will accept defendant.

records.addlTxt: Deceased
request to transfer to the Huber facility in Milwaukee filed by defendant.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Hugo C Galan in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2.5 Years.
5 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actor listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs: $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
First 3 Months to be served Straight-Time - FORTHWITH.
Second 3 Months to be served with w/huber (all standard release conditions)
Last 3 Months STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.   
Court will allow for the condition time to be served in Milwaukee County if they will accept him.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
